instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7122: What is R7122? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b charger stops working
threads.message:
hi, got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b, works fine except that the charger shuts off after a while (light goes off and its not detected). Only happens with battery connected. I have to unplug and plug the charger again for it to start working again. 

Tried 3 different batteries, different charger and different DC in jack,

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b charger stops working
threads.message:
Test the machine disconnecting BIL.
The battery is charging properly?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b charger stops working
threads.message:
The charger stops working even with everything disconnected. 

Yes, the battery usually chargers for about +1% then the charger shuts off.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b charger stops working
threads.message:
Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
Run EFI ASD with battery connected, if possible.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b charger stops working
threads.message:
<CHIP>U7100</CHIP>:

Resistance between pins 17/18 = 3.6 ohms

 Resistance between pins 27/28 = 0L

ASD with battery connected says nothing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b charger stops working
threads.message:
"Resistance between pins 27/28 = 0L"
Check <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>/22 and their traces.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b charger stops working
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R7122</RESISTOR> had a crack in the solder. Thanks a lot.
